meanings.definition: The act of sailing or traveling all the way around something, especially the world.
meanings.sent1: The brave explorer completed a circumnavigation of the globe.
meanings.sent2: The ship's captain planned a circumnavigation of the Earth.
meanings.sent3: The circumnavigation of the world was a thrilling adventure for the crew.
meanings.sent4: Her journey was a circumnavigation of the planet's vast oceans.
meanings.sent5: The circumnavigation of the Earth took months of preparation and courage.

meanings.definition: The act of going completely around something, especially by water or air.
meanings.sent1: The airplane's circumnavigation of the storm was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer's goal was to achieve a circumnavigation of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The hot air balloon's unexpected circumnavigation of the city caused a stir.
meanings.sent4: The satellite's orbit resembled a circumnavigation of the Earth.
meanings.sent5: The bird's effortless circumnavigation of the tree amazed onlookers.
